thread.title: Michigan State vs. Purdue live stream: TV, time, channel, how to watch online
thread.title_full: Michigan State vs. Purdue live stream: TV, time, channel, how to watch online | NJ.com

author: Dan Duggan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Michigan State vs. Purdue live stream: TV, time, channel, how to watch online
text:
Rutgers has its lone bye of the season this week, which means this might be that one fall Saturday you spend apple picking or doing whatever non-college football fans do on fall weekends.
But with an ominous forecast, you may be confined to indoor activities. Although the Scarlet Knights won't be in action, surely you can find plenty of entertainment from the first full slate of Big Ten games .
While there may be more juice surrounding a pair of matchups in the West Division (Minnesota at Northwestern and Iowa at Wisconsin), Rutgers fans should have more of an interest in the Purdue at Michigan State game on Saturday at noon on ESPN2.
Ranked No. 2 in the nation , the Spartans will arrive at High Point Solutions Stadium next Saturday for a matchup with Rutgers. Michigan State rolled, 45-3, in last season's meeting so the Scarlet Knights should have revenge on their minds as they watch Saturday's game.
Here's everything you need to know about Saturday afternoon's matchup:
When: Saturday, Oct. 3 at 12 p.m.
Where: Spartan Stadium, East Lansing, Mich.
TV: ESPN2... Beth Mowens and Anthony Becht will call the game, with Paul Carcaterra working the sidelines.
Radio: SpartanSportsNetwork.com...George Blaha and Jason Strayhorn will call the game, with Keith Nichol working the sidelines
Live stream: WatchESPN
Line: Michigan State -21.5
Here are five stories you need to read to get ready for the game:
1. Statistics, computer ranks suggest Michigan State a pretender
2. Michigan State players say coach Mark Dantonio "ain't trippin' "
3. Eight things learned about Michigan State in non-conference play
4. Michigan State offensive line backed into a corner with injuries
5. Michigan State defensive end Shilique Calhoun named Big Ten Co-Defensive Player of the Week
